abstract: Topps said Monday that it would postpone a vote on a $385 million buyout offer by two private equity firms, including one run by Michael D. Eisner, after a Delaware chancery court judge ruled that the baseball card maker must disclose more information about the deal. Topps said it would also allow a rival, Upper Deck, to make a tender offer to its shareholders, in accordance with the decision by Judge Leo Strine Jr.
